title: Live entertainment
text: We enjoyed the live band that was playing during dinner. The drinks were average but the menu has a large selection.

title: THE BEST
text: Wow.. everything on this menu looked amazing. It was hard to pick a dish. The Mahi tacos were the best I’ve had. There was a large variety to choose from and a lot of specials on the menu. Their mimosa and sangria menu has quite the variety as well. We were so bummed that we found this place on our last night and weren’t able to try their brunch.

title: Best drinks
text: The bartenders here make the best drinks! Mexican mules, margaritas; and the Bloody Mary with bacon were all a few of our favorites. You can tell how fresh caught the fish is as well.

title: Nice location
text: We enjoyed staying within walking distance to everything we needed yet still being in a quiet relaxing environment. The pool was nice, kind of small but it wasn’t crowded while we were there. All the workers were extremely kind and helpful. I’d definitely stay again.

title: Worth the wait?
text: When we went to check out the Southernmost Point the lines were probably about an hour long.. there were people skipping line and trying to take pictures around the marker. Wasn’t worth the wait for us in the heat, so just be prepared if you really want a picture at this spot.

title: Backcountry kayak and snorkel tour
text: Our crew of James, Pax, and Harley made the trip awesome! We enjoyed their company and hospitality. The food and drinks were plentiful and I’d highly recommend the tour overall. It was the first time snorkeling for some of the people on our boat and Harley took extra time to go out with them and make sure they were comfortable.

title: Conference
text: The rooms were freezing! The employees were doing everything they could to fix it but throughout the entire conference I attended, each room was freezing and there were technical difficulties at almost every session.

title: Great brunch
text: Came for happy hour and appetizers and wasn’t totally impressed. I came back for brunch though and it was amazing. The mimosas were great and there were a lot of different options.

title: Best froze
text: This place has a great happy hour Monday through Friday from 3 to 7 p.m. They also had the best froze of anywhere we found in Deep Ellum. I’d recommend for apps and drinks!

title: Served the purpose
text: I was sent to Peppermill work a work conference and was pleasantly surprised. While the restaurants are a bit pricey, the food and drinks were good everywhere we ate. The campus is so large that we didn't really need to leave for anything which was a bonus as well.

title: Great experience
text: I enjoyed dinner at the Atlantis steakhouse because of the experience they make out of it. The service was 5 stars but the food was 4 stars. The drinks, sides and desserts we ordered were really good but the seafood I got was a bit disappointing.

title: Traditional, but not for us
text: My husband and I ate here from a recommendation we received from our hotel. We like to try new things, so we were open to the traditional Ligurian cuisine. We were sat outside which has a nice view of the town. Then we waited about 20 mins and no waitress ever came. By then we had looked at the menu for too long and didn’t want anything on the menu but felt rude leaving. The food was good, but not something we’d like to eat again.

title: Best appetizers
text: My husband and I stopped in here after dinner because it was the only place he could find a local IPA. The service was great, they brought us appetizers and my husband had a few beers while I had aperol spritzers. We sat outside, but the inside had a game room with a pool table. Definitely a hidden gem!

title: Great food, great prices
text: In Levanto it was hard to find a restaurant with anything other than fish and seafood dishes on the menu. My husband and I weren’t in the mood for that and found this place to have great cocktails, appetizers, pasta, and a variety of dishes. I’d highly recommend!

title: Great place to stay!
text: We stayed in Levanto for the 3 nights we had in cinque terre. The hotel is on top of a hill but provides free shuttle to and from town and the train station. We enjoyed staying in Levanto and taking the train to the more tourist places like monterosso. The hotel was very friendly, clean, had good breakfast selection and a nice pool.

title: Highlight of our trip
text: My husband and I spent 2 weeks in Greece and Italy for hour honeymoon. I’m cinque terre we had a private tour guide named Pall from Viator who spent the day showing us around, hiking trails, telling us about the culture, history, and individual people he’s met. He let us know about a local beef and ravioli festival going on in a village on the mountain and spent the night drinking homemade wine and eating with us! It was the highlight of our trip.

title: Quick stop, large menu
text: We stopped in for lunch on the way back to our hotel. There is a large menu of every kind of spaghetti and pizza you could imagine. The pizza is very thin style but tastes very good! Prices are decent as well for lunch in Rome.

title: Yum!
text: We were stopped by a very enthusiastic man ushering us on for dinner but we were starving so we sat down. The food was delicious! The wine recommended was great as well. Fast service.

title: Pasta, wine, and limoncello!
text: We visited for dinner after a recommendation from friends. The restaurant was able to get us in without a reservation but I would recommend one just in case. The atmosphere is quiet compared to the busy streets of Rome. Everything we ordered was delicious. I explained to the waiter what kind of wine I typically enjoyed and out of their huge selection he pulled one that was perfect. The service was great and the food was the best we’ve had so far. It is within walking distance from the Spanish steps and definitely shouldn’t be missed!

title: Great location, great staff
text: This hotel is located within walking distance to everything you need in Athens, and the staff is wonderful. I would Highly recommend the hotel to anyone who wants to be right in the middle of everything.

title: Authentic
text: We made reservations at this restaurant based on prior reviews. We arrived an hour early for our reservation and they welcomed us in. The food was authentic and everything on the menu was great! Make sure to make a reservation, people walking in weren’t able to get a table.

title: Worst experience in Athens
text: I booked Dinner in the Sky as our special dinner for celebrating our honeymoon as our last night in Athens. We arrived, were greeted with welcome cocktails, and were so excited for the experience. (We planned our whole day around it.) We were told to lock our belongings up and get in line to board. We filled out our waiver and our passes were taken. Nothing was said to us.. then as we were waiting in line to go on we were told we couldn’t go on because we booked through Expedia (reputable website? Yes) and our reservation hadn’t been received. We then were *promised* by the gentleman that boards guests that he would find a way to get us on. In hindsight it was because there were 2 people who were late. He also whispered to us that there was another group of 6 whose reservation was lost but they would apparently take us on instead of them, and that also if the couple that was late booked through Expedia, they would take us instead. As a business that is so unprofessional. They then had us wait on the side while everyone else was strapped in, at this point we had wasted over 2 hours of our time getting there and standing there. Of course, the last two people showed up late, and were let on. The gentleman who *promised* we would get on disappeared and the man who stated he was the owner came to speak with us. He was rude, and short with us when we tried to explain we had spent so much time, not to mention spending a ridiculous amount for a cab, and pretty much wasted our last night in Athens. At this point I was crying because this was supposed to be the highlight dinner of our honeymoon. The owner didn’t seem to care, after all the dinner was full so he wasn’t missing out on any money. As a business owner, I understand that while it may not have been his fault that our reservation was lost (even though somehow our names were on their list and that we had booked through Expedia) it is your job to do everything you can to accommodate the customer. I left feeling like it was a slap in the face. I can’t comment on the experience or the food because we didn’t get to experience it, but based on the experience we did have I would never recommend this place to anyone, I’d highly recommend against it. The owner threw 25 euros to us for our cab ride there.. great.. and then we had to spent an additional 40 euros for a cab ride back to our hotel. At this point it was almost 9 and every restaurant we went to was so crowded that we had to pick up a gyro from a walk up place. Great last dinner in Athens.

title: Absolutely wonderful
text: We stayed at Absolute Bliss for 3 nights during our honeymoon in Santorini. From the moment we arrived the staff (manager Sofia) welcomed us with a smile, drinks, and snacks while our room was getting ready. The view is spectacular, in my opinion the best sunset view we had in Santorini. Every single staff member is extremely nice and accommodating. Everything is also very clean and organized. The room service and drinks are very reasonably priced and the service was great. Breakfast was delivered to our balcony every morning as well, and there are many options to choose from. Sofia made a reservation for us at the wine bar, and due to a restaurant having a similar name, we didn’t realize until a couple hours before that it wasn’t at the restaurant we wanted. It wasn’t anyone’s fault; the names were the same. When the wine bar we wanted couldn’t fit us in, Sofia went above and beyond to find a solution. She offered to have us order from a local restaurant and have it delivered to our balcony so we could have dinner at sunset on our balcony since it was our last night. She then personally came up to our room, brought tons of pretty candles and lights, and had our dinner delivered right at sunset. She also gave us a bottle of local wine to enjoy with dinner. The hotel is beautiful and worth it in itself, but out of all the traveling I have done the staff here has been the BEST! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a romantic get away in Santorini. We will most definitely be back!

title: So good!
text: This restaurant was recommended to us by a couple at the pool. They said they had eaten there 3 times during their stay because it was that good! We decided to try it for our last dinner in Santorini, and we were not disappointed. We had a few appetizers and entrees and everything exceeded our expectations. I would highly recommend!

title: Amazing!
text: We booked the sunset cruise through a recommendation from a friend. We were picked up by Dmitrius who was happy, friendly, and an awesome driver. (The streets of Santorini are a bit difficult to drive with all the ATVs cruising around.) we were greeted by the crew, with Lianna leading the way. Everything about the cruise was perfect. There were about 8 couples on board, and a small child. The crew was accommodating to dietary concerns from the beginning. As we cruised around our drinks were kept full and the crew constantly made sure everyone was happy. The dinner Lianna prepared was mouth watering. Greek salads, pasta, fish, chicken, everything was delicious. As the sunset crept up as we got close to Oia, Lianna began to sing and play the guitar. Her voice was truly the voice of an angel! It made the end of the experience unforgettable. I would highly recommend this excursion to anyone, but if you can get Lianna and her crew you are in for a treat!

title: Worth the money
text: We decided to find a beach in Athens for a day to take a break from sightseeing. After looking a bit around I decided to spend the 30 euro per person for a beach chair for the day at Astir beach. It was totally worth it! The facilities were clean, and the beach was beautiful. Food and drinks were reasonably priced the we had great service. It was the relaxing beach day we wanted!

title: Have to see it
text: We decided to visit Acropolis without a guided tour and I’m glad we did. We waited in line for about an hour, which was actually quicker than I expected as it was a busy afternoon. When we got in we were free to explore around as we wished. If you are interested in details about the history I’d recommend a tour, but we were satisfied exploring on our own.
